isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Installation - Upper Main Bearings and Crankshaft Assembly

svcproc.title: Upper Main Bearings and Crankshaft Assembly

step1.para: Rotate crankcase so main bearing saddles are facing up.
Clean oil off crankcase main bearing saddles with a lint-free cloth. Do not lubricate the back side of main bearings.
Install thrust main bearing in the rear #7 upper main bearing saddle. Make sure locking tab on bearing aligns with notch in the crankcase.
Install the remaining six upper main bearings in their corresponding saddles. Make sure locking tab on each bearing aligns with notch in the crankcase.

Apply marker paste ( Prussian Blue®
or equivalent) on the crankshaft main bearing journals.

caution.para: To prevent engine or vehicle damage, do not drop, bend, or gouge crankshaft.

step1.para: Install and center an appropriate lifting sling on the crankshaft, supported by two connecting rod journals.
Carefully lift and lower the crankshaft onto the upper main bearings in the crankcase.

note.para: Do not install the main bearing caps at this time.

step1.para: Carefully remove the crankshaft and inspect the upper bearings for an even transfer of bluing agent from the journals to the bearings.

item.para: If voids appear in the blueing agent transfer, inspect and measure the crankcase and crankshaft. Correct any problems and then repeat steps 7 through 13.
If the bluing agent transfer is even and normal and the crankcase and crankshaft are not damaged then proceed to step 10.

step1.para: Clean all marker paste off bearings and crankshaft journals.
Lubricate upper main bearings with clean engine oil.
Install and center an appropriate lifting sling on the crankshaft, supported by two connecting rod journals.
Carefully lift and lower the crankshaft onto the main bearings in the crankcase.
